thought.author: Andy Hunt
description: Unless you fancy shipping faulty software, one should apply appropriate testing techniques, ideally, let your tests drive implementation. Today's issue of #ThoughtsOnProgramming features Andy Hunt, author of the "The Pragmatic Programmer", a timeless introduction on how to contribute maintainable code on teams.
thought.quote: No one in the brief history of computing has ever written a piece of perfect software. It's unlikely that you'll be the first.

thought.author: Larry Tesler
description: How would modern user interfaces look like without copy & paste? Today's issue of #ThoughtsOnProgramming features Larry Tesler, who invented the cut, copy and paste commands during his time at Xerox PARC.
thought.quote: You cannot reduce the complexity of a given task beyond a certain point. Once you've reached that point, you can only shift the burden around.
